posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Well, this cat (as GDL would say) is dangerous, very dangerous.

With Maximum Dwarven Strength boosted by EWS & Rogue Shenanigans, such as Crippling Strike and 5 dice of sneak attack plus Set Traps/ UMD & Dev. Critical he threatens the boundaries of illegal ammounts of power.

And while many other characters have to sacrifice playability for achieving such ends, he does not. Extremly playable from the beginning to the end - he gets only stronger as you rise in levels.

Solid Hp's, wonderful saves boosted from Moradin himself, many - talented with 250 skill points & every combat feat you would dream off, he can take upon any task and will live to tell the tale.

While there are many builds with this combination, none has the offense or the raw power of this one by far and he lack's nothing in return, a feat which i am very proud off!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey man!

Since you pointed me back here again, I will suggest yet another tweak. Take your Rogue levels from 12 to 14, from 17 to 19, from 23 to 24 and from 28 to 29 so that your modified ranks in UMD update alongside Tumble. Your charisma modifier is -2, you need to take that into account. The other levels can stay where they are as UMD is maxed out by then.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content: Depends on the gear available. Tumble you would be taking as soon as you can get to the next 5 as the bonus is based on ranks not taking bonuses into account. But if you have gear that boosts charisma or UMD where you are playing then accounting for the bonus to be a multiple of 5 might not be all that practical.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
WhiZard wrote:

But if you have gear that boosts charisma or UMD where you are playing then accounting for the bonus to be a multiple of 5 might not be all that practical.
It would never cross my mind to equip this guy with any CHA gear. But yeah, theoretically you're right. If you are playing in a world that has useful items to you with either CHA or UMD boosts, you don't need to do what I suggested. In my experience, however, there aren't enough gear slots to equip a toon with everything you'd like him to have, and Cha or even UMD boosting items would be at the rock bottom of the list in terms of priorities.

Take it EZ!

Take it EZ!
First the UMD increasing item does not need to be equippable.  A rod that casts eagle's splendor or aura of glory would do.  Also the UMD needed for equipping items is only a factor when you are equipping them.  So I could temporarily equip an item that would allow me to equip another item and then replace the first item with something more practical.  There are many modules I have played that have allowed me to get over the 1 or 2 difference between the ranks of tumble and skill UMD simply from the items available.  Unless there is a chance you might unequip an item during battle (e.g. polymorphing, ruin armor, disarm, switching to range/melee) then you should not have to worry about UMD during fights.  (Scroll usage is an exception, but that does not have 5 level gaps between increases).

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: If you really feel deadly gas traps are worth the extra 10 points in Set Trap, then fine.  But I'd sooner reach UMD 35(33) to cast up to Level 9 scrolls without failure.  In any event, losing 3 points from Locks won't be haunting you. With +10 picks DC 47 locks will open easily.  Swallow a Cat pot or 3, if it is borderline.

posts.author: Dingpot
posts.content:
Thank you very much for this build Valerfor, which I currently have at Level 10 on Greyhawk.

As part of my learning process, what do you get from the 7th and 8th levels of Fighter that you would not get from 2 more levels of Champion?

Cheers!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
In Valerfor's absence, I'll try an answer for you @Dingpot. Fortunately, it's not a complicated one. If you were to take 2 more levels of CoT instead of Fighter you'd lose a bonus feat. CoT only gets them every 4 levels after 10 (so 14, 18, 22, 26 and 30), while Fighter continues to accrue them every 2 levels. And that's about it.

Cheers
